text: God is each truly and exalted thing, therefore the individual himself to the highest degree. But are not nature and the world individuals?
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

text: Humans have certain properties and characteristics which are intrinsic to them, just as every other organism does. That's human nature.
author: Noam Chomsky

text: As I grew older, I realized that it was much better to insist on the genuine forms of nature, for simplicity is the greatest adornment of art.
author: Albrecht Durer

text: Societies have always been shaped more by the nature of the media by which men communicate than by the content of the communication.
author: Marshall McLuhan

text: Disease is the retribution of outraged Nature.
author: Hosea Ballou
